Generation I.Red: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.
Generation I.Yellow: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by DIGLETTs.
Generation I.Stadium: Its large body is over 26 feet long. Despite its size, it can squirm its way through the ground at 50 mph .

Generation II.Gold: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.
Generation II.Silver: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
Generation II.Crystal: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pok é mon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
Generation III.Sapphire: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pok é mon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
Generation III.Emerald: There is a magnet in its brain that prevents an Onix from losing direction while tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes steadily rounder and smoother.
Generation III.FireRed: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour .
Generation III.LeafGreen: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to black-colored diamonds.

Generation IV.Diamond: When it travels underground, it causes rumbling and tremors. It can move at 50 mph .
Generation IV.Pearl: It squirms through the ground using its long and rugged body. It always eats while burrowing.
Generation IV.Platinum: It burrows through the ground at a speed of 50 mph while feeding on large boulders.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

Generation V.Black: It burrows through the ground at a speed of 50 mph while feeding on large boulders.
Generation V.White: It burrows through the ground at a speed of 50 mph while feeding on large boulders.
Generation V.Black 2: Opening its large mouth, it ingests massive amounts of soil and creates long tunnels.
Generation V.White 2: Opening its large mouth, it ingests massive amounts of soil and creates long tunnels.

Generation VI.X: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
Generation VI.Y: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour .
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.

Generation VIII.Sword: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
Generation VIII.Shield: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: When it travels underground, it causes rumbling and tremors. It can move at 50 mph .
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It squirms through the ground using its long and rugged body. It always eats while burrowing.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground, feeding on boulders as it goes.
